review.review_title: Absolutely brilliant, and the best cloud-storage solution!
review.review_text: ownCloud is perhaps one of the very best Open Source projects to date... Though it is important to note that much of its functionality depends of how you implement ownCloud (e.g. How much space you allocate, the infrastructure and hosting you utilize, etc). In saying this, the official Android application for ownCloud looks great and seems to work well, leaving little reason to look at other cloud storage solutions, particularly if you're concerned about privacy and security... Very highly recommended.
Needs widgets for accessing quickly to folders and files. Local to server and Server to local folder synchronization.

The OwnCloud app doesn't resume partial uploads, or retry failed uploads... it just lets everything fail. Even if you retry, you'll just hit the same problem again.

Hopefully it's just an in development issue waiting to be addressed. Just tried viewing pics through browser and it works great so here's hoping.

This mobile app works well if the server you're hosting ownCloud with is correctly configured. A large majority of the bad reviews posted here are results of incorrectly configured server settings. Supports encryption, and functions similar to Dropbox, Google Drive, or any of those other cloud based data storage and sync services. One complaint is that if you'd set a file to be synced upon changes, the setting is only respected if you launch the file through ownCloud. If it could watch the files that are downloaded, selected for sync and upload the modified file upon editing it with actual app that is designed to open in , as opposed to having to go through ownCloud each time, this app would have five stars.

It even plays music within the app without having to open a media player (not always a plus: it does only one song at a time). I wish it were easier to switch between accounts but it's not that bad. I like how it can back up my photos to my server without having to go through Google. Especially useful for work photos that I don't want to share with a third party.

Not interested in an app which needs so much configuration, too much configuration takes out the productivity. So as much as I would like to give this app a full house of stars because it's probably just awesome, I give it only 3 due to the info wasn't clear enough to me about how this app functions and then that it needs your own webhosting, which is probably great, but not that great for me. Perhaps others think it's great, but that doesn't apply to me. So, I'm sorry for my bad review and actually would like a refund although I think your app is awesome, just not awesome for me.

review.review_title: Pretty, but missing a bunch of BASIC features.
review.review_text: No recursive upload. No way to sync only selected subfolders. No way to specify directory for 'instant uploads'. No way to shedule sync other that android builtins. Fails to sync for no apparent reason. Fails miserably if loses network while syncing. Issues 1 & 2 have been open on github for OVER 2 YEARS with no progress whatsoever, utterly hopeless. Seriously, just use Foldersync.

Tried installing on a Samsung Galaxy S5, tried both rooted and non-rooted. Works fine on an old T-Mobile SpringBoard (Huawei MediaPad) with Android ICS, but under the KitKat load on the Galaxy it keeps going 'Server took too long to respond' every time I try to connect. I know this is a client issue because, as mentioned, the load on the SpringBoard works perfectly well. This also means the server side is OK with Apache as the web service end. No, I'm NOT changing my entire web structure to Nginx just to accommodate what should not have to be accommodated! This is a client-side issue and needs to be fixed at that level. Two stars only until this problem is dealt with.

Bought it because I like the idea, but I actually just need it for one very purpose (sharing one or two files directly via send to -> owncloud on the device for which I haven't found a replacement yet). Using FolderSync for more complex syncing these days as the owncloud client definitely is _very_ bare-bone. At first, simply naming this owncloud is a bit misleading - it should possibly be owncloud file client as it is limited to handling WebDAV/files and ignores anything else owncloud has to offer - calendar? vcards? Plus, even in transferring files, the app leaves things to be improved: Making the storage folder configurable would be a start - I definitely would like to have this on external_SD in my device. Same, a real folder sync would help - this is basically impossible at the moment (if I manually create folders or files in the owncloud folder on the Android device, the app still doesn't see or transfer these). Maybe future versions will do better here.

Select folder needs to be an option. Even select folders to sync. Just getting this app to work drains the battery. Such a lot of work is needed.
The latest releases are really getting better and better. Would like to see the ability to sync to more than one own cloud instance. E.g. a private one at home and one remote.

I installed the app and tried it a few times; it seemed to work on my server's stored files, and I successfully sync'ed a few back to the server. Unfortunately when it's installed something uses excessive battery. I notice even when nothing is being used (and owncloud does not appear at all in the battery usage indicator so I cannot be sure). I have uninstalled it. Whenever I reinstall it the phone gets hot and the battery runs down quickly.
When you get it you'll understand.

UPDATE: New build just thrashes the battery. Had to uninstall... I already sent an error log in. Missing multi select, needs to be updated to SDK 16+, UI still has portions of Froyo/GB with the download/upload intent. Sync can be slow at times. It has a ways to go, but has potential. Just use foldersync for now. Chokes on large uploads, server is configured to allow large uploads as well. Things it needs: 1. Calendar sync adapter to Android Calendar 2. Contacts sync adapter to Android Contacts 3. Multi-select to modify files: move, delete, copy (You can only delete right now, but can not multi-select) 4. Need to add an option to only allow uploading while charging as well 5. Option upload videos as well 6. Thumbnails support for videos/pictures 7. Support for ownCloud docs 8. Better tablet support These additions will get it to a 4 - 4.5, then some refinement on top of that.
Dont wast the 99 cents

Major improvement over previous versions. I stopped using ownCloud at the beginning of 2013, and just came back to it today. The app works really well now, and isn't plagued by most of the issues it was a year ago. The only thing that's bugging me right now is the persistent notifications for things like instant image uploads and file downloads - that should be configurable in app settings.
Thanks for the sharing funcionality. One thing I personally would like to see being improved is the picture viewer. However the app works already quite well.
Great package all round and the app is becoming useful.
While I like owncloud, this app is relatively useless outside of the auto photo backup. Need the ability to specify syncable folders so that sync'd files aren't copied to the owncloud directory.
A very well featured private alternative to public cloud services.
Had lots of problems connecting when iOS could connect just fine. Turns out Android ownCloud prefers IPv6 so make sure you open this up in your firewall as well!
Everything works great and they finally added sharing
I am sure this will have much more functionality before long so worth the 63p, 1 dollar in my opinion to support development.

There is great potential for this app, but it lacks some standard features that one has come to expect from similar apps such as Dropbox. At this point I find that two missing features in particular stand out: (1) no thumbnail view of images and (2) no ability to send links to files. Other useful additions to the app would be the ability to select multiple files, an integrated way to sync contacts and calendar, and the ability to choose where the files will be stored (external SD card rather than phone memory would be nice). I consider my purchase a donation to a good cause and hope to see improvements through user support.

review.review_title: Works but quite basic sync client
review.review_text: Installation and connecting to my own owncloud was quick and painless. However the client is severely lacking in some basic features: 1) No way (?) to sync the entire contents of your owncloud - have to sync each file/folder individually. This may be a good thing as it allows you to only sync the items you actually want on your phone, however it would be equally good to be able to say sync all and then unselect certain items. 2) No way to specify the location on your phone. This is a BIG problem for people whose main memory is more or less full but have an SD card available. 3) No way to specify the auto-upload location of photos. 4) No way to share files/folders with other users While owncloud itself is great I struggle to be able to recommend this client in its current state as a paid-for app. Once fully-featured, I'd be more than happy to recommend it.
Will not connect to Own cloud. Works with my PC connecting to own cloud. Help.

review.review_title: Just what I've been looking for ... almost
review.review_text: The app works great except for the fact that it syncs all data on the root directory (/) of the phone (device). It would be fantastic if the sync directory was on the sd card (ExtSdCard) instead. This way it wouldn't take up all the space available and slow the phone (device) down. I would say many users would prefer this. Also, please know that I looked into moving the app to the sd card but this phone (device; that being a Samsung Note 2 / Sprint / CDMA) has specific hardware constraints that will not allow this. So please consider adjusting the app to include the ability to do the above. Thank you for all your hard work and have a fantastic day!

review.review_title: Doesn't work with too many files

My server was running the whole night and has 100MBit internet access (16GB RAM, Core i5 CPU), and my internet connection is ~20MBit up and ~50MBit down. And the server doesn't do anything so far except serving owncloud. Please fix that, or don't ask any money for it. I'm using Samsung Galaxy S2 - if anybody has that amount of files and it works for him with a different phone, please tell me - thx

--Latest version won't let me sync - gives me invalid password even though pwd IS correct and I'm already logged in. Please fix! Nice for a start, but very basic. Multiple file selection, keep files synched with sd and you're off to a good start!

review.review_title: Add a prompt to reinstall jelly bean workaround at start
review.review_text: And the bad ratings will go away! Owncloud is a great private solution, this app, while not google drive, does the job :)
Owncloud updated to latest version. Can't login. Keeps saying invalid password. Yet I can login with the same info on 3 other pc's
I love own cloud server but the app needs more options primarily a select all or select folder to sync option. I have 100s of pics on my phone and to select them individually is a little ridiculous
Newest update has returned this app to its former glory. Thank you owncloud team
Used to work fine. Now I can't get it to work properly. Disappointed. Will be using Dropbox on my phone on the mean time. (Edit: Worked again after update to 1.4.3. Many thanks)

review.review_title: Instant Upload doesn't work on 2.3.5 (HTC EVO 4G)
review.review_text: I can not get instant upload to work on my phone. Otherwise, things seem to be getting better with every update. Keep it up! I would love for this app to eventually provide calendar and contacts sync as well.
Scans my 50k files on startup.
When sharing from other apps it crashes everytime. Android 4.1.*. Disappointing it does not work having bought it.

I love the idea of running my own server for file sharing and syncing. And owncloud works fine on the desktop. But the mobile clients are horrible. The android client won't sync automatically (you have to tell it to sync, even when downloading a file). And the iOS app is actually worse. So even though it's free to setup and use, it's not worth it.

I support this effort because we have to get off commercial data repositories. Corparations get rights to your family photos and writings when you put them on things like dropbox. But the syncing all broken constantly. On this app and the server you run at your house. Owncloud will be better in a year but is unrelyable as is. But they are moving fast and towards something truely great so kudos. If this was a paid company though it would surely be a zero.

Didn't work on my Samsung galaxy S4 neither on my iPad..I just wasted my money and time. . keeps giving me invalid credentials while it works well from any browser. Tried installing and Uninstalling the work around many times but still didn't work.
The app freezes on my phone most of the time. Other than that it does everything as expected when it's working.
If server encryption is enabled, this app becomes unusable. And overall it does not play nice at all with JB. Instant upload is a no go on JB. Android 4.2.2

After latest update the Send function from my other android apps doesn't work with Owncloud. I can send to Dropbox just fine but sending to ownCloud doesn't work. I tried uninstalling and fully deleting directory with fresh reload but no help.

I had an update or two now and I have had to reinstall the app to get everything up and running again. I am not sure if this is an issue with the owncloud android app or the fact that I have enabled the experimental encryption on owncloud. in anycase this app has not let me down on my lg motion 4g for metropcs and I would give it five stars if I could set password or combination rather than a 4 number pin. regardless I love this app, it has given me control over my files and how I can sync them on all my devices.

review.review_title: Great start, needs lots of work
review.review_text: Running better with every update!

The app works really well. Instant upload works like a charm. I have more than 40.000 files, and the app sometimes crashed or did not want to show parts of my files. All in all the app has room for improvement, but for 0.99$ I really could care less. All required functions work for me.

App used to work great until today's release. Now I can connect to my owncloud (self hosted) but cannot access it nor upload files. Any clue? EDIT: it almost worked with uninstalling/reinstalling JB Workaround. I can now access account, but it seems that every upload/download is failing. EDIT2: after removing app (and wiping data with Titanium) and reinstalling/updating everything seems to be working fine. Cheers to Christopher!

review.review_title: Need to reinstall the jelly bean workaround
review.review_text: After upgrading to 1.4.1, I was no longer able to log into my OwnCloud server. The web server always reported that invalid credentials were being supplied. I found that I had to uninstall the Jelly Bean Workaround helper app, then reinstall it, before I was able to log in.

review.review_title: Missing some features, basic features work
review.review_text: I've been using this app for a while and for the most basic operations (reading a file that is sorted in my ownCloud server) it works well. What I am really missing (and what has caused me to look elsewhere) is the ability to automatically sync an entire directory and to automatically upload new files I created in the owncloud directory on my mobile device. I can share a single file from an app, but this is too cumbersome for my needs.
Keeping the faith. ! Remembering this is an open source project under development. Getting better with every release. folks. Some of us really appreciate the efforts.

review.review_title: I've been using this for a while...
review.review_text: And in the end it just hasn't cut it. The instant upload fails and never retries and the backend server is just too slow and unwieldy. Moving on elsewhere. Still a long way to go for me to come back to owncloud.

review.review_title: Great dev & app, but not so great serverside client
review.review_text: The developers are very responsive and courteous. The feature I requested was responded and added within a week. This app has great potential, however it seems serverside and/or desktop client are not so great. Server and desktop programs were so buggy(such as infamous infinitely bloating conflict file) I had to abandon the whole installation on my private server. Anyhow, if you are already utilizing ownCloud on your server, this app is a solid (if not the only) choice.
Image viewing, download of whole folders, bidirectional sync of files and folders, to name a few

I LOVE Owncloud.. It's the best dropbox solution ever where you don't have to worry about people snooping your data. PLEASSE PLESAE PLEASE PLSAE PLSAEPL SAEPLASE PLSAE put time into make this awesome. I paid $.99 and I'd pay more to an indigogo or something
Brilliant works like charm all my pictures are uploaded as soon as I take a picture and now I have my secret documents in one place

review.review_title: Client is Junk. Use a WebDAV viewer isntead
review.review_text: Refreshes have to be done MANUALLY. Files have to be downloaded before viewing. Image support is junk. OwnCloud is a good service though. Thankfully one can access your OwnCloud store through any WebDAV client. I use either FX File Explorer Plus (Paid) or ES File Explorer (free, and better).

love that it can upload pictures taken but it has one major drawback.. if the upload fails you have to manually upload it. It does not retry to upload the failed pictures. In my case happens a lot because of limited data connection and spotty wifi areas. As long as i am at home and have wifi it uploads fine.. If they could fix this it would make it worth the $1.

The main thing I needed this for was the photo upload, which works but requires manual intervention (folder creation) due to a known bug. For the rest, file sync doesn't seem to work and uses massive amounts of power while doing so. The UI is crude, but good enough. I haven't tried any other features.
Great app interface

review.review_title: Para quienes no quieren confiar sus datos a tercer
review.review_text: La idea es genial! La aplicación para Android y los no lo es tanto. En la año falta poder compartir, ver los compartidos. A quienes no le funcione la subida instantánea deben crear la carpeta InstantUpload en la raíz de owncloud desde interfaz web y subir una foto. Despues de eso cualquier foto hecho con el movil subirá automaticamente
Not perfect, but good

review.review_title: Instant upload assumes you have a crappy camera
review.review_text: 2MB file size restriction? Doesn't even say why, just fails. Can't change this setting either.

I already sync all of my home and work PC's via ownCloud, and love it. Having access on the go is a great add on. The app works well for the most part but the instant upload feature appears to be broken, at least on CM10.1 (Android 4.2.2). After taking a picture there is a toast popup that complains about not being online the first time instant upload is running, even though I have full 4G service and the wifi only option is disabled in the app. Tried it w/ wifi on and it still failed. Update: Manually creating a folder named InstantUpload got rid of the warnings and the feature started working. Looks like there is a bug in the code that creates the folder if it doesn't exist.
I got this app to use the calendar.. :-( (I did not read the overview)... Only for documents. This app is far from offering all owncloud services.... OwnCloud is great, this app is as great.

review.review_title: Great app But still need Move to SD support
review.review_text: But needs move to sd support. Takes up 4 mb of internal storage. Every MB counts
Doesn't even sync it connects but fails on everything waste of money

All synced files have a copy created in the owncloud folder on my phone. So for every gig of backed up photos, I am using 2 gigs of storage space. After having dumped the product I have decided to consider just deleting this folder occasionally.
I've just installed it on my home server and it works great!
Works
Works nicely
Keep those features coming it's getting more and more useful to me. Very powerful!
It's a very cool app and I really enjoy the features but I can't update to the latest version because it says it can't install to SD card. This is a Nexus 7, it has no SD card.

In addition I had to symlink the InstantUpload directory on my server so that it would sync photos to the same directory on my PC (since that folder isn't synced directly like dropbox). I'll give 5 stars once it's polished a little more. :-)
Doesn't allow you to change any sync locations like the desktop app.

review.review_title: Non functional app, sad I paid for it
review.review_text: This app is terrible. As others have said, some folders just never show up, and hitting refresh gives an error. Even worse, this app does a ton of wakelocks and drains my battery for no apparent reason. Needs a ton of work just to be able to do what it claims
Poor Feature
It has very high battery drain. I have wakelock for more than 1 hour in 9 hours of usage and I have not even opened ownCloud today. Aside from this - good start.

This app is not of much use for me. Sync doesnt work properly, refreshing the remote content list takes ages. At least a picture slideshow would be very nice. So long, i prefer foldersync to keep everything up to date and use any webdav browser to access the owncloud server. Anyway, nice idea. Hopefully this app will improve soon...

So it works fine for me except for the photo upload feature. This is in particular bad for me as my Droid DNA doesn't have an SD card and this would be great for backup. So I still have to use Dropbox for this.

but would be better if you could cache directories locally like dtopsync. Also needs a progress indicator.
no contact or calendar sync
It will get 5th star when there will be possibility to sync contacts and calendar :)

review.review_title: Good enough if it was alpha version
review.review_text: Stops all the time. Just stays there and uploads nothing. And then it hangs up. I don't know if it doesn't like my home installation of owncloud but hey it should be error proof enough and not hang up like this. It should report errors if any.

Obviously has a few bugs still in it, but after a week of testing the auto photo upload just dosen't work... Checked with mine and a freinds server still no luck... But im happy to support the developer and hope it gets fixed later.
Need a way to share a file to the others via this mobile app. I hope it will be implemented soon.
This software in it's current state is quite unusable. Takes 10 minutes to refresh the file list over wifi.
request sharing
Great app, missing Contacs/Calendar Syncing support and Video InstantUpload, In general a better integration into androids account management would be great

It's great to have the ability to access your owncloud files from tablet or phone, but in real life it's still way too alpha for everyday use. I have a big tree of directories and files (for example, copied my complete dropbox in it), and even if I'm using a decent wifi connection, some files are synced, the others are not. There are folders (of which Work seems to be the most important one) which simply don't synchronize. I guess it is because the syncing process halts at some moment, but if you compare the speed with which Dropbox shows folder content and with which Owncloud shows folder content --> that's a huuuuuge difference. In short, I think it's going well, but more frequent updates would definitely be nice as would a more complete GUI and smarter syncing be (give priority to a directory I'm viewing instead of syncing some other one I probably don't need for another week).
Great so far, can't wait to say good bye Dropbox once more features are added..... Calendar sync please, then I can stop Google snooping too!
Best thing since sliced bread
Works great for photos, but needs access to apps available in Web client
But it won't upload videos for me. Its a great project and I hope it long continues. So thank you for your efforts so far.
Only thing i would really like at this point is to choose external storage for the download location

Je recommande si vous avez installé l'application serveur
Should not be a paid app at this.point,but hopefully it will get there
Keep it coming people. Its a great community project which has given so many people a free self-govorned backup medium. Roll on v5!

S'installe très facilement sur mon Galaxy SIII. La synchronisation des photos se fait automatiquement. De quoi avoir partout sous la mains les fichiers que nous avons besoin. A part l'application Android de ownCloud, le client PC est un bon accessoire également, on dira que les 2 font la paire. A recommender si vous avez un serveur ownCloud, un bon investissement.

Having just converted over from SparkleShare, I'm pleased with my purchase. This app is not too flashy, but nevertheless well-thought-out and plenty useable. This is a very complete alternative to Dropbox et al.
I can't thank your team enough. I usr ubuntu server and this integrated very easy! My thanks... JP
Stable and fast.
Hello guys, big thanks for producing such a great product. Works perfectly on my Nexus S. Can't wait for ownCloud 5.

I bought this app a few months ago to support the owncloud project. It didn't work with my ownCloud server running on nginx. I think this was the apps fault as there were alot of bad reviews. Tested it today and it works wonderfully. Instant picture upload worked and the app is snappy and does as it's told. This is now my way of saving + sharing photos from my phone, and will replace evernote once we can get autosync. Thanks ownCloud team! I knew this app would come together!

review.review_title: Does not sync well to local storage
review.review_text: Works as expected, but you can't designate where to store downloaded files, nor can you have it automatically sync to local directories except by selecting single files. Automatically uploading photos does not work.

The only feature needed is the ability to view files, especially photos without having to download them.
Not up to par with Dropbox but still pretty cool. I wish I could stream content

(0) The pictures that are newly uploaded are corrupted? My computer is not able to read the recently uploaded. (1) Fails very frequently to upload pictures. No chance to retry? How do I see the list of failed upload other than the notification bar? Clicking on fail notification should lead to the file that failed to give a chance to retry, and to know the reason. How about a red X on the files that failed when browsing? (2) Nice additions: select all, video/picture thumbnail view, todo list sync. (3) For the OwnCloud server, Google Calendar/Contact sync, not just mounting GDrive.

review.review_title: Doesn't look good on a tablet
review.review_text: Yes, it's low cost but maybe a trial period for evaluation would be better. Will come back and update my review once i've had chance to test. Struggles with multiple uploads.

Works good but would be nice to be able to select multiple files and directories for syncing. Aside from that, its works pretty good from what I can see. Have just had it installed for two days now.

The best ive found anywhere! You guys are the best! I recently got a new phone and once i installed this app everything from my old phone appeared on my new phone. Im a happy camper..

Can only download certain mime types, thinks epub files are folders and can't download them, other types of files aren't even listed in the folder view.
Nice and simple. I have no problem paying for this since Owncloud server was free. Keep up the good work Owncloud developers.
I guess I should have just kept the original one by Bartek Przybylski? This one keeps loosing my account info on JB 4.1.1 ... continued development would be nice though.

review.review_title: No automatic sync makes this app useless for me
review.review_text: I'm really a fan of OwnCloud. I installed an instance on my linux server at home an sync several windows PCs. But without an automatic synchronization of files modified on my android device, this app is absolutely useless for me. I hope you guys will implement this feature ASAP. I will check GitHub. Perhaps I can do it on my own.
It should include contacts and calendar sync, its more important than synchronising files on mobile phone.

I agree with earlier posts, it should not be out of alpha release: why should I pay for this? Downloading multiple files crashes app/phone, keeping files up-to-date crashes app/phone. You can download single files and upload single files. This app has less functionality than the web GUI. Quit charging people for your broken trash.

Any network failure to connect to an own cloud server and it forgets the account which stops instant upload as well. Not the best programming decision. I shouldn't have to continuously be reading my server info.

After spending an age trying set this up on my server, failing, and then opting to pay for a hosted install I'm actually very happy with this. Not quite sure how reliable at backup this is just yet but so far so good

Can't believe I paid money for this. Biggest bug bear is that it loses account credentials on reboot, and I do that a lot considering I'm using cm10 roms. And it's been like this for a while. No acknowledgement or a fix. Use, and but only if you never reboot, then else it'll just get too painful.
Modifying a keep sync file causes infinite upload loop to the server. Unusable in my opinion. Maybe in the future
Getting better

Accepts any certificate without complaint. Currently too insecure to use on public wifi. Thankfully openvpn works well, making it possible to securely run own cloud for now. Desperately needs certificate pinning!

Not prefect but seems to be getting better all the time. Have disabled the instant picture upload because it didn't work very well but find the ability to access my files anywhere really good. Thanks and keep up the good work.

review.review_title: Okay, but has a way to go
review.review_text: EDIT: The latest version seems to fix battery drain issues. Why can't I download a folder? Why am I unable to press a button to get a share link in the file context menu? I could do that on the Tonido app, and I really miss it. On the plus side, instant upload seems really nifty.
